metadata.Title: CVE-2015-9253 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in PHP 7.3.x before 7.3.0alpha3, 7.2.x before 7.2.8, and before 7.1.20. The php-fpm master process restarts a child process in an endless loop when using program execution functions (e.g., passthru, exec, shell_exec, or system) with a non-blocking STDIN stream, causing this master process to consume 100% of the CPU, and consume disk space with a large volume of error logs, as demonstrated by an attack by a customer of a shared-hosting facility.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-9253` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10

php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10

Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

notes.Note: leosilva> in 7.0 upstream patch caused a regression according with upstream that is the possible the missing patch: https://github.com/php/php-src/commit/cc5c51e7f0732067f105d13c6d355fcab5965c2f rodrigo-zaiden> php7.0 for xenial was released with above patch.

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty/esm was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm10').
